SqlStatement

public SqlStatement(java.lang.Object broker_ref,
                    java.lang.String state)
Constructor that uses a priority of 4 (average urgency) to create an Sql Statement

Parameters:
broker_ref - Object reference to the Broker that requested this statement
state - Statement to send to Database

                    java.lang.String state,

Constructor that uses a custom priority, from 0 to 7 to create an Sql Statement

state - Statment to send to database
p - Byte priority

public byte getPriority()
Getter to retrieve priority from SqlStatement

getBrokerReference

java.lang.Object getBrokerReference()
Returns the Broker instance so that the application can return the ResultSet back. Yes, this is an area may cause a bottle neck, but SqlStatement is only required when all brokers use one Singular Thread to contact the database. Having independant Broker db connections would negate the need for this class and hence the resulting bottleneck.

Returns:
Object instanceof Broker object

getStatement

public java.lang.String getStatement()
Returns the statement that was sent to the database.

Returns:
String statement to request from database

issueStatement

java.sql.ResultSet issueStatement(com.mysql.jdbc.Connection con,
                                  java.lang.String str)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
By supplying a proper connection, this will issue a command to the database through the connection and will set the class variable ResultSet to the results which will be returned. It can also be retrieved through the getResult() method and set using setResult(ResultSet rs, String statement).
The setter requires the statement (as a string) because the cache looks at the statement given when retrieving previous results.

Parameters:
con - Connection to database
str - String statement to database
Returns:
ResultSet results from statement
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - error is returned from statement

getResult

public java.sql.ResultSet getResult()

setResult

protected void setResult(java.sql.ResultSet result,
                         java.lang.String statement)
